events.name: Friday Hacks #94: Welcome Tea & The Creation of NUSWhispers
events.description:
Friday Hacks are back for this new academic year! 

Please join us in our Welcome Tea, where our president will share about what we do, the importance of fostering hacker culture in NUS and how to hack life!

The folks behind the popular NUSWhispers, Yang Shun, Erin, Yichen & Melvin will then reveal the story behind NUSWhispers, NUS's largest anonymous sharing portal with over 15,000 active users!

All freshmen & current students from all faculties are welcome to attend. As always, free pizza starts at 6.30pm ;)

Read on to get a quick idea of what we do:
NUS Hackers is a student-run organization committed to the spread of hacker culture & free/open-source software. We provide a support system for hackers in NUS who are currently building things (be it for charity, business or pleasure). We also hold workshops, organizer weekly meet-ups, run hackathons, and maintain open source code for the NUS community.
events.location: Seminar Room 1, School of Computing, National University of Singapore

events.name: A joint meetup with Singapore Network Engineering.
events.description: We will talk about below topics: • rDNS • LACP • GPON And demo using MikroTik hardware, after all this is MikroTik User Group :)
events.location: SiS Building, 4 Leng Kee Road #03-03, Singapore

events.name: NTUOSS Welcome Tea 2015
events.description:
We would like to invite you to our first event - Welcome Tea 2015.

Join us to learn more about NTUOSS! Get a preview of what exciting events we have lined up for you this semester, learn about our committees and how to join us, and get to know the awesome community full of technology enthusiasts!

Details are as follows:
Venue: INNOVATION CENTRE (Block 1, Unit 110)
Date: Friday, 21st August 2015
Time: 7pm
Refreshments will be provided :)

events.name: TPM Sound Deck | Feat. NUS Electronic Music Lab
events.description:
Groove to the beats of traditional Asian rhythms interspersed with electronic dance music. The NUS Electronic Music Lab, a multi-genre music collective, will close the night on a musical high with their experimental take on Peranakan music.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The NUS Electronic Music Lab (EML) is a performing arts group that creates, produces, remixes, performs, records and promotes original electronic music. It is based at the Centre For the Arts in the National University of Singapore.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Set times:
21 Aug (22 Aug, 1am): Ocean's Children
22 Aug (23 Aug, 1am): The Kids with Laptops (Kester, Skysprinter, nanowander)

28 Aug (29 Aug, 1am): Ocean's Children
29 Aug (30 Aug, 1am): Mitch Advent, David Phoon & a combined EML set

Expect every set to be different, so please come down to watch all 4 sets =)

The gig will be happening on the stage at Armenian Street opposite the Peranakan Museum.

events.name: Conversations: “~sound:senses”
events.description:
“~sound:senses” 

Saturday 22nd August 2015
2.30pm to 5.30pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

What is the colour of sound? Does the shape of the plate change the taste of the cake?  This August, join us as leading artists and scientists in the fields of psychology, sound art, perception, and multimodal design come together to explore how sound acts as the glue connecting our sensorial experiences and interactions. Guest speakers include luminaries such as interaction designer, Stefania Serafin, crossmodality researcher Charles Spence, composer Joyce Beetuan Koh, filmmaker Daniel Belton, and psycholinguist Suzy Styles. Chairing the event is PerMagnus Lindborg, organizer behind Soundislands Festival 2015 and a celebrated sound artist and researcher in his own right. The event will close with a special performance by CLUBbleu who will showcase their signature sounds of electro-acoustics, deep drones and broken blast beats.

The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, initiated by PerMagnus Lindborg with support from CLASS and ADM at Nanyang Technological University, the Italian Institute of Culture, and the Arts Council of New Zealand.

Schedule

2.30-2.45: PerMagnus Lindborg
Opening and welcome address

2.45-3.00pm: Dr Suzy Styles, Assistant Professor, Nanyang Technological University
Language: Spoken, Heard, Connected 

3.00-3.15pm: Daniel Belton, Artistic Director, Good Company Arts
Movement: When One Falls 

3.15-3.30pm: Joyce Beetuan Koh, Senior Lecturer and Vice Dean of Interdisciplinary Studies, Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts 
Stage: Illusions and Involvement

3.30-3.45pm: Charles Spence, Professor, Head of Crossmodal Research Laboratory
Cuisine: Scent. Crunch, Palate 

3.45- 4.00pm: Stefania Serafin, Professor, Aalborg University Copenhagen
Objects: What’s an Instrument?

4.00-4.15pm: BREAK

4.15- 5.15pm: Panel discussion with speakers, moderated by PerMagnus Lindborg

5.15-5.40pm: Music Performance by CLUBbleu

5.40pm: Event Close
